qas.question: Who is the second largest business district employer?
How many people worked for La Defense in 2010?
What field did the majority of the employees at La Defense work in?
What percentage of people worked in business support?
What two districts are extensions of the Paris business district?

context: The second-largest business district in terms of employment is <a0_0>La Défense<a0_0/>, just west of the city, where many companies installed their offices in the 1990s. In 2010 it was the workplace of <a1_0>144,600<a1_0/> employees, of whom 38 percent worked in <a2_0>finance and insurance<a2_0/>, <a3_0>16<a3_0/> percent in business support services. Two other important districts, <a4_0>Neuilly-sur-Seine and Levallois-Perret<a4_0/>, are extensions of the Paris business district and of La Defense. Another district, including Boulogne-Billancourt, Issy-les-Moulineaux and the southern part of the 15th arrondissement, is a center of activity for the media and information technology.
